title: Devil Times Five
description:
[img]http://img512.imageshack.us/img512/3347/dtfhg6.jpg[/img]

DEVIL TIMES FIVE

1974 / Color / 1:78 anamorphic 16:9 / 88 min. / Peopletoys, The Horrible House on the Hill / Street Date November 21, 2006 / 19.95 
Starring Sorrell Booke, Gene Evans, Taylor Lacher, Joan McCall, Shelley Morrison, Carolyn Stellar, John Durren, Leif Garrett, Gail Smale 
Cinematography Paul Hipp, Mike Shea 
Art Direction Jac McAnelly 
Film Editor Byron &#039;Buzz&#039; Brandt 
Original Music William Loose 
Written by Sandra Lee Blowitz, John Durren, Dylan Jones 
Produced by Michael Blowitz, Dylan Jones, David Sheldon 
Directed by Sean MacGregor, David Sheldon, Sandra Lee Blowitz 

Synopsis: 


A transport bus from a hospital for disturbed children crashes, loosing a number of dangerous small fry into the snowy mountains. Brian (Tierre Turner) thinks he&#039;s a combat soldier and David (Leif Garrett) fancies himself a child star. They&#039;re chaperoned by a novitiate nun named Sister Hannah (Gail Smale) who&#039;s also off her rocker. The group comes across the large house of Papa Doc (Gene Evans), who is hosting a weekend get-together with his business underlings Rick (Taylor Lacher) and Harvey Beckman (Sorrell Booke). The wives include a nymphomaniac (Carolyn Stellar) and a drunk (Shelley Morrison); Papa Doc&#039;s housekeeper is the mentally impaired hulk Ralph (John Durren). No sooner have the kids arrived then they set out to lay traps for the adults in the house. A series of horrible murders follows.
